title: Hebrew font
content: I'm look ing for a "hebrew" looking font that is NOT faux hebrew. I once had a few before I lost all my fonts. ![hebrew](http://web.archive.org/web/20111220144242im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/12442.jpg) ![hebrew](http://web.archive.org/web/20111220144242im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/12443.gif)
author: samiam

comments.content: One of your images didn't show up. I'm assuming the one that did show up is what you would call "faux Hebrew" and is not what you're looking for?
I'm not sure I understand the difference. Could you be more specific, please?
I need to find a font that looks like faux hebrew,
Its the same font. I'm looking for something similar to Faux Hebrew (same style)
What is it about this font that's not what you want?
I have this one. But there is another one that is similar that I need. I used to have it but I don't know the name and I can't find it.
Sorry, samiam, looks like I can't help you.

it was called shalom   
   
Thanks Dave.

Dan Solo of Solotype had a font called Shalom. It exists in some poorly-digitized versions on the web, but he did a digitization himself before he closed up shop a few years ago. I'm not sure how widely available his version is. ![shalom](http://web.archive.org/web/20111220144242im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/12486.jpg)

here's a couple that might be useful, though they're not the same   
   
 [http://www.dafont.com/en/search.php?q=jerusalem&nb\_ppp\_old=10&page=1&texte=&nb\_ppp=10&Envoyer=%A0%A0OK%A0%A0](http://web.archive.org/web/20111220144242/http:/www.dafont.com/en/search.php?q=jerusalem&nb_ppp_old=10&page=1&texte=&nb_ppp=10&Envoyer=%A0%A0OK%A0%A0)   
 [http://www.dafont.com/en/search.php?nq=1&q=sefer&Submit=Go](http://web.archive.org/web/20111220144242/http:/www.dafont.com/en/search.php?nq=1&q=sefer&Submit=Go)
do u have for mac computers
